relationships.description: Chief Investment Officer of J.P. Morgan
Colleagues at J.P. Morgan who suggested sharing the market commentary with clients

transactions: investment grade and high yield credit

analysis.purpose: To provide market commentary and investment strategy insights to clients following significant financial market developments
analysis.significance: Detailed analysis of 2011 European debt crisis and US economic concerns from J.P. Morgan's Chief Investment Officer

notable_quotes: "The last two weeks have been a severe setback for financial markets and the global recovery."
"Our job is not to point to where we would like the financial markets to go, but rather to point to where they might end up."
"Great corporate profits are no guarantee against a problem in financial markets."
red_flags: Admission that economic forecasts were inaccurate
Concerns about systemic problems in public sector finances

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present in this financial market commentary

illegal_activity.description: Document contains standard financial market analysis with no illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: This type of market commentary from major financial institutions during the 2011 European debt crisis would have been of significant interest to financial media and investors

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan's Chief Investment Officer Michael Cembalest provides a detailed market analysis following significant financial turmoil, discussing European sovereign debt concerns, US economic risks, and the firm's investment strategy adjustments, while acknowledging lessons learned from recent market developments.
